definition: a benefactor/a person who has significantly helped sb else

sentences.english: From a different vantage, credit was an economic white knight.
sentences.chinese: 從一個不同的角度來看，信用是經濟的救命恩人。

sentences.english: He did much credit to his patrons.
sentences.chinese: 他爲他的恩人爭了很多面子。

sentences.english: It is normal that he love you.
sentences.chinese: 再說他還是你的救命恩人。

sentences.english: White recognized the voice: It came from one of their rescuers.
sentences.chinese: 小白聽出了那個聲音，那是她們的一位救命恩人。

sentences.english: He is not only my pet dog, but also my savior.
sentences.chinese: 他不僅是我的寵物狗，也是我的救命恩人。

sentences.english: After all he was your savior.
sentences.chinese: 再說他還是你的救命恩人。

sentences.english: Ackbar managed to convince the Verpine to join the Alliance.
sentences.chinese: 阿克巴設法讓韋爾派恩人加入同盟。

sentences.english: Mr. Li is not only the school's benefactor, but also our savior .
sentences.chinese: 李先生不但是學校的功臣，並且是我們的救命恩人。

sentences.english: Now, your benefactor is knocking on the door I currently reside.
sentences.chinese: 現在你們的恩人正在敲我目前居留地的門呢。

sentences.english: Mother and daughter of fine jade of the Song Dynasty does not tell the truth, think he is the savior is very obliged.
sentences.chinese: 宋琪母女不知真相，以爲他是救命恩人非常感激。

sentences.english: This is the story between me and my savior.
sentences.chinese: 這就是我和我的救命恩人之間的故事。

sentences.english: Don't trouble yourself about them, my benefactor, but buy my picture.
sentences.chinese: 您不用管他們，我的恩人，還是買我的這張油畫吧。

sentences.english: He thought of the old man as his lifesaver .
sentences.chinese: 他把老人看作他的救命恩人。

sentences.english: Cactus is a walking entrants in the vast desert savior.
sentences.chinese: 仙人掌是行走在茫茫沙漠中行者的救命恩人。

sentences.english: Greece may have benevolent benefactors but I doubt China will be as lenient.
sentences.chinese: 希臘可能有樂善好施的恩人，但我懷疑中國會否寬仁。

sentences.english: Do not think i bother, after all, i am your savior.
sentences.chinese: 你不要覺得我煩，畢竟我是你的救命恩人。

definition: like a second parent (idiom); one's great benefactor
your favor amounts to being given a new lease on life (idiom)
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
hard to forget even after one's teeth fall out (idiom); to remember a benefactor as long as one lives/undying gratitude
lit. the kindness of recognizing sb's worth and employing him (idiom)/patronage/protection
to pay a debt of gratitude/to repay a kindness
to meet with misfortune/to fall into dire straits
grateful and seeking to repay the kindness (idiom)
to shed tears of gratitude (idiom); moved to tears
